body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     People     People: The Civil War Era                People: The Civil War Era         Members of the Farnsworth Post of the Grand Army of the Republic gather at St, Paul's Church, Memorial Day 1887. NPS  Henry Schlote, Served with Two German Regiments in the Union Army James Hyde: Zouave soldier buried at St. Paul's. James Polite: Former slave from S.C. served with the Union Army and buried at St. Paul's. Matthew J. Graham: Fought at Antietam, buried at St. Paul's, wrote about his regiment. Daniel Lawlor: 'Fighting 69th' Civil War Veteran, buried at St. Paul's. Jacob Ham: A Civil War soldier, buried at St. Paul's, who served with "Old Steady", the 128th New York Volunteer Infantry. Civil War Soldiers Who Died in Service: This is an account of those of whom are buried at St. Paul's. George Carter: Civil War Veteran Frederick Whittaker: Custer's First Biographer Hiram Slagle: Lost, then found Civil War soldier. Dr. Charles S. Taft Stephen Hunt: Civil War Veteran. His life centered upon St. Paul's. Michael McLaughlin: The Long Road of a Civil War Sailor to St. Paul's. Harmon Bloodgood: The only Civil War veteran buried at St. Paul's
